citation.article-title: Novosphingobium panipatense sp. nov. and Novosphingobium mathurense sp. nov., from oil-contaminated soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Novosphingobium mathurense sp. nov.
Novosphingobium mathurense (ma.thu.ren′se. N.L. neut. adj. mathurense pertaining to Mathura, the place of isolation of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, flagellated, non-sporulating rods (1.4×0.8 μm).
Colonies are yellow, smooth, circular, convex with entire margins and 1.0–1.5 mm in diameter after 3 days incubation at 28 °C on LB.
Negative for catalase, oxidase, nitrate reduction and lecithinase.
Casein, starch, gelatin, xanthine and Tween 20 are not hydrolysed, whereas aesculin, hypoxanthine and Tween 80 are hydrolysed.
Glucose, fructose, galactose, lactose, xylose, raffinose, arabinose, maltose, mannose, rhamnose and trehalose are assimilated, but myo-inositol, sorbitol, mannitol and melibiose are not.
Degradation of phenanthrene, naphthalene and anthracene is negative by the zone-forming test on plates.

Phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine, sphingoglycolipid, phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine, phosphatidyldimethylethanolamine and unknown phospholipids, phosphoglycolipid, glycolipid and polar lipids are present.

The fatty acid profile contains C14 : 0, C14 : 0 2-OH, C16 : 0, C16 : 0 2-OH, C16 : 1ω5c, C17 : 1ω6c, C18 : 1ω5c, C18 : 1ω7c, iso-C18 : 1 H, C18 : 0 and summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH).
The type strain is SM117T (=CCM 7473T =MTCC9020T), isolated from oil-contaminated soil.
